newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Nippecraft up on hopes of stake sale.
newsitem.headline: Nippecraft up on hopes of stake sale.

text.p: Diary maker Nippecraft attracted speculative interest on Tuesday morning on talk that a major shareholder could be reducing his stake.
At 0246 GMT, Nippecraft was up S$0.06 to S$0.665 on 5.1 million shares.
"It's the usual takeover stories when the market thinks some shareholder might be selling his shares," said a dealer.
"The absolute value of the shares are low and it's very easy to push the stock up," said another dealer.

In March, Nippecraft said one of its major shareholders, Highwell Investments Ltd, had sold 12 million shares at S$0.60. Highwell is owned by Kingstoun Investments Pte Ltd which in turn is owned by Evan Coady, chairman of Nippecraft.
After the sale, Coady's deemed interest in Nippecraft was reduced to 128 million shares from 140 million shares.
